content: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?>  <reference anchor='RFC0028'>  <front> <title>Time Standards</title> <author initials='B.' surname='English' fullname='Bill English'> <organization>Stanford Research Institute (SRI)</organization></author> <date year='1970' day='13' month='January' /> <abstract> <t>We are about to install a relatively accurate real-time clock on our system.  I would like any comments relative to Network time standards for such things as delay measurement so we can decide how good our clock should be.</t></abstract></front>  <seriesInfo name='RFC' value='28' /> <format type='TXT' octets='557' target='http://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc28.txt' /> </reference>
